column4: 00:02.0 VGA compatible controller: Intel Corporation 82845G/GL[Brookdale-G] /GE Chipset Integrated Graphics Device (rev 03) (prog-if 00 [VGA] )
is this what you were looking for
yes, the problem is, the screen is so big that i cant see the buttons at the bottom of windows
it says i only have one screen resolution
you need to have more resolutions available on your screen? as in 1024x768 and 1280x1024 ?   edit xorg.conf and add them manualy to the list then restart x
in the terminal    type  gksu gedit /etc/X11/xorg.conf    about half way down the file you will see the list of available resolutions , follow the syntax carefully
you have an intel video card ?
what kind of screen ?
I think that's an ati or nvidia card,   closed gedit, goto  menu > system > admin > restricted drivers , see what it tells you
there is a catch ,  you'll need to give us 6 months of your time troubleshooting other ppl for each problems of yours we solve
ok,  you will need to check your documentation to make sure what video card model you have,  just to make sure
anyting look like the intel 86.... series of your vidoe card ?
hold on let me look
ok  when you look in  menu > system > prefs > resolution  , what is it set to ?
from the command line type   sudo dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg , when in doubt use the default answer provided
what are your options ?
what are the other options ?
copy , paste to pastebin
forget the copy paste fro now look for something in the intel 82845  range
go for vga
you need to turn off capslock first
ctrl alt backspace will restart X   and should start the new settings
sorry aboutthat,   sudo dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg,  and pick only the default options
